AI is the death of Google (search).

Here's the why + the remedy:

1/ Google search is dying – the data

☑ 58.5 % of U.S. Google queries ended without a click in 2024 (SparkToro)(searchengineland)

☑ Google’s AI Overview now shows on 11 % of queries (up 22 % YoY) and chops click-through by ~30 % (BrightEdge) (thelettertwo)

☑ Only one in five visits to the world’s top-100 sites now starts on a search engine (Semrush) (barrons)

☑ New York Times share of Google traffic slid to 36.5 % in April 2025 (44 % in 2022). (wsj)

☑ Business Insider’s search traffic is down 55 % vs 2022; it cut 21 % of staff on 29 May 2025. (wsj, reuters)

☑ Chegg trades 98 % below its 2021 peak, erasing $14.5 B in value. (indianexpress)

____

2/ When search dies, AI wins.

☑ ChatGPT hit 500M weekly active users and a $10 B revenue run-rate in March 2025. (ft)

☑ Perplexity logged 780M queries in May 2025, 22M active users, and is raising at a $14 B valuation. (techcrunch, reuters)

____

3/ Stay relevant with LLMs (like ChatGPT) – how?

Step 1: Download the CSV of your Google Analytics.
Step 2: Upload it on ChatGPT with this prompt:

Prompt: "Act like SeniorTrafficAnalyst.  
When I paste a Google-Analytics CSV:  
1. Parse it.  
2. For each URL show visits, % google/organic, % other search, % direct.  
3. Mark any URL with google/organic >40 % as RISK.  
4. Finish with a 100-word brief on the top three structural risks.  
Return plain-text lines, TAB-separated, then the brief.  
Think step-by-step."

Step 3: Rewrite needed articles, or add new ones.

Some tools are doing SEO for LLMs. I like PromptWatch. But they have (many) competitors.

____

4/ Search better without Google – how

An example with lithium-ion thermal runaway.

1. Perplexity → “Summarise in 6 bullets the causes of lithium-ion thermal runaway; cite sources.”  

2. ChatGPT (browse on) → “Critique this answer; fact-check each bullet; add two missing insights.”  

3. Kagi → lithium "thermal runaway" filetype:pdf published:>2019 !reddit !quora 

4. Then paste top PDF into ChatGPT → “Extract experiment setup + numeric results only.”  

5. Or you can skip the 4 previous steps and go straight to "Deep Research" from ChatGPT.

____

Search isn't (really) dying. It's shifting. Are you?
